author: lundblad
msg: Improve the speed of the xdelta algorithm by avoiding lots of small memory
copying.
Review by: jerenkrantz
julianfoad
* subversion/libsvn_delta/xdelta.c (find_match): Take a pointer to the
length of the pending insert instead of a stringbuf.
(compute_delta): Keep track of the start and length of the new data that is
pending to insert instead of stuffing the new data (one byte at a time:-)
in a stringbuf.  Remove useless assert (for readability).

author: jerenkrantz
msg: ra_serf: Properly drive deletes relative to the WC root.  Now passes switch
test #1 (test some basic switching operations), #2 (commits after some basic
switching operations), #7 (show logs for a switched file), and #9 (switch that
deletes a sub-directory).
* subversion/libsvn_ra_serf/update.c
(start_report): Pass the full WC-relative path name to delete_entry and
pass the dir_baton_pool to delete_entry.

author: dlr
msg: * STATUS: Nominate r18983.

author: dlr
msg: A follow-up to r17910 (r18156 on the 1.3.x branch) to allow
libsvn_swig_py to link on OpenBSD.  Linking with Python 2.3 needs the
-L /.../config and -lpython2.3 arguments.  (Unsure what happens on
OpenBSD with a version of Python which has no lipython2.X.so -- it's
apparently been removed from the ports tree.)
A more correct fix down the road for cases like OpenBSD should be to
inspect the tool chain (e.g. linker, Python library version, etc.),
rather than the OS.
* build/get-py-info.py
(link_options): Add -LSTATIC_LIDIR and -lpythonVER arguments on
OpenBSD.
Found by: Sigfred H. <bsdlist@mumak.com>

author: jerenkrantz
msg: ra_serf: Pass update test #23 (update target that was added in a future rev).
(All update tests now pass.)
* subversion/libsvn_ra_serf/update.c
(close_dir): If we didn't fetch the dir's properties, don't expect to see
properties for that directory.
